required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Brain Damage Due to Coronary Angioplasty in Percutaneous Intervention Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Silent Brain Injury in Chronic Total Occlusion Patients With Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the formation mechanism and patient-related factors of silent cerebral infarcts, whose importance has become increasingly recognized in patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study was produced from the assistant's thesis and was previously accepted as a poster at EuroPCR 2020. We recently completed the full-length article.
This thesis study was supported by Ondokuzmayis University.

primary_outcome.time_frame: NSE blood levels were measured 1-2 hours before the procedure.
primary_outcome.description: Baseline NSE measurement to exclude non-PCI dependent brain injury. Elevation of >20 ng/ml was considered as silent brain injury. Patients with basal nse elevation were considered as SBI and excluded from the study.
NSE blood levels were measured 12-18 hours after the procedure. Elevation of >20 ng/ml was considered as SBI.

arm_group.description: Chronic total occlusion patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.
Non-Chronic total occlusion patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.

intervention.description: The Silent Brain Injury ratio was compared by measuring the Neuron-specific enzyme level with venous blood sampling from both patient groups before and after percutaneous coronary intervention.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were planned to have revascularization due to CTO in at least one coronary artery (CTO Group) and patients who were scheduled for single-vessel elective coronary intervention other than CTO were defined as Non-CTO (control group).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CTO and Non-CTO patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- baseline NSE elevation
- acute coronary syndromes or cardiac surgery within 4 weeks
- patients with a cerebrovascular accident
- intracranial hemorrhage
- and head trauma
- central nervous system tumor
- degenerative central nervous system disorders and neuroendocrine tumors
